title: Michael K. Gureghian
text:
Hello! I’m Michael Krikor Gureghian, a senior studying Statistics & Data Science at UCLA. I’m passionate about finding connections in data to establish understanding and insight when it isn’t innately there.
I have extensive experience working with medical research and biostatistics, but also have practiced some financial analytics and data engineering. This experience has informed a lot of my analytical skillset, and I’m excited to see what future projects will help me learn and grow even more!

title: Assessing the Effects of Bladder Decellularization Protocols on Protein Content
text:
The extracellular matrix (ECM) provides scaffolding and structural support for tissues. During tissue transplant, we can apply decellurization techniques to remove cellular components which could trigger an immune reaction to the transplanted tissue, but we want to preserve the ECM in order to maintain structural integrity.
I performed protein analysis in R which assessed the protein intensity change from natural bladder tissue to treatment-applied tissue, evaluating two different decellularization protocols. This proteomics study was a component of a larger ongoing study which evaluated the effectiveness of different decellularization techniques with the intent of developing an optimized and generalized protocol.

title: Assessing the Effects of Bladder Decellularization Protocols on Protein Content

title: Assessing the Effects of Bladder Decellularization Protocols on Protein Content
DNeasy Decellurization DNA Concentration Analysis
text:
During tissue transplant, we can apply decellurization techniques to remove cellular components which could trigger an immune reaction to the transplanted tissue.
This study evaluated the DNA concentration change from natural tissue samples to decellularized samples using a decellularization protocol we found was most optimal in this study. I used R to create visualizations to better evaluate the DNA concentration data that the lab team collected in this study.
